text: Hey folks. I am doing a community management course at the moment and one of my tasks was to write an overview of my community that would explain it to someone from outside the group. I chose to write it about the R contributor community as that is one of the communities I want to foster. You can read my draft version here: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/18uS6Wo9MmZ2_YXYOAkwgOhxZ8yLbaPCFI5FX0QzpO5c/edit> - happy for you to add comments in the doc or let me know what you think here!

elements.text: Hey folks. I am doing a community management course at the moment and one of my tasks was to write an overview of my community that would explain it to someone from outside the group. I chose to write it about the R contributor community as that is one of the communities I want to foster. You can read my draft version here:
- happy for you to add comments in the doc or let me know what you think here!

text:
I made some suggestions to the first paragraph, but I find the second paragraph a bit confusing: there is the R core, the R contributor community the R contribution working group and the representatives of the wider R community, and the minoritized groups. But it is not clear to me how do they work together (or just co-exist like a forest?). Am I representative of the R community? The work I'm doing is from/for the R Consortium or the R Foundation? I would introduce the different groups later, but not sure how.
The third and last paragraph are great. I didn't know about the _Directions in Statistical Computing!_
